title: EPIC E1: Evaluation Foundation
description: Weeks 1-3. Establish deterministic datasets, baseline metrics, CI smoke checks, and dashboards used as hard release gates.
acceptance_criteria: Baseline dataset lock file exists and is versioned
Per-commit and nightly metric jobs are defined
Baseline outputs are published as artifacts for comparison

title: E1-S1: Pin datasets and stand up deterministic evaluation harness
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Build dataset lock and baseline harness plumbing for similarity/type/diff metrics.
acceptance_criteria: A locked dataset manifest exists with reproducible versions/checksums
Evaluation entrypoints run in a clean environment without manual steps
Seed and environment controls are documented and enforced

title: E1-S2: Add per-commit smoke metrics and nightly regression pipeline
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Wire CI jobs for smoke metrics and nightly full regression comparisons.
acceptance_criteria: Per-commit smoke job publishes metric artifacts
Nightly regression run compares against previous baseline
Failures are surfaced as blocking signals

title: E1-S3: Run and publish stock baselines for semantic search and type recovery
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Measure stock baseline metrics and publish comparator artifacts. Implementation scope: .github/workflows/eval.yaml + eval/* scripts; avoid broad docs-only changes.
acceptance_criteria: Baseline run covers selected benchmark slices
Results are versioned and traceable to code/dataset revisions
Baseline summary is accessible to all lanes

title: E1-S4: Build metrics dashboard and alert thresholds for MVP gates
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Provide dashboard and alerting for recall/latency/receipt/rollback gates.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows current and trending values for all MVP exit gates
Threshold breaches trigger actionable alerts
Dashboard data is reproducible from saved artifacts

title: EPIC E2: Receipts + Proposal Workflow
description: Weeks 2-6. Build receipt-first proposal flow with review/apply/rollback as the default mutation path.
acceptance_criteria: Proposal-only workflow exists for rename/type/comment mutations
Every auto-applied change includes a receipt
Rollback can restore previous state reliably

title: E2-S1: Implement receipt schema and append-only receipt store
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Introduce core receipt persistence model and hash-chain integrity semantics.
acceptance_criteria: Receipt schema supports actor/action/target/evidence linkage
Append-only writes are enforced for receipt history
Receipt integrity verification detects tampering

title: E2-S2: Build proposal state machine and review/apply API
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. REOPEN: enforce strict proposal lifecycle invariants in Java; remove OPEN->APPROVED shortcut and align service/tests to documented transition model.
acceptance_criteria: Review actions are accepted only in UNDER_REVIEW state; direct OPEN approvals/rejections are rejected
Invalid lifecycle attempts raise InvalidStateTransitionException with state details
Unit tests prove OPEN->UNDER_REVIEW->APPROVED path and fail direct OPEN->APPROVED behavior

title: E2-S3: Implement transaction-safe apply and rollback adapter
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Wire approved proposals to transactional apply/undo semantics.
acceptance_criteria: Apply operation records transaction + receipt linkage
Rollback restores pre-apply state for batch and single changes
Automated rollback tests pass for representative scenarios

title: E2-S4: Capture and render evidence links for every proposal
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Persist xrefs/constants/callsites evidence and display in review UI.
acceptance_criteria: Evidence references are stored with stable identifiers
Review UI can inspect evidence per proposal
Evidence remains intact after apply and rollback

title: EPIC E3: Capability Guard + Policy Modes
description: Weeks 2-7. Enforce capability-scoped execution and policy modes (offline, allowlist, cloud) with auditability.
acceptance_criteria: All tool invocations are capability-checked
Policy mode enforcement is test-covered
Security regressions block release

title: E3-S1: Enforce capability-token guard on all agent/tool operations
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. Implement capability checks for read/write/execute surfaces.
acceptance_criteria: Every tool entrypoint validates capability token before action
Denied operations fail closed with explicit reason
Capability checks are covered by unit tests

title: E3-S2: Implement policy modes and endpoint allowlist enforcement
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. REOPEN: wire policy modes/allowlist enforcement at runtime entrypoints instead of unit-only surfaces; ensure context artifacts are real and reproducible.
acceptance_criteria: All outbound runtime paths pass through policy enforcement layer before network access
offline/allowlist/cloud mode behavior is validated by integration tests against real call paths
Policy enforcement artifacts referenced by bead context exist in-repo and are executable

title: E3-S3: Add permission audit logs and violation incident records
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. REOPEN: connect permission audit and violation incident records to actual denied/allowed runtime actions with export/query coverage.
acceptance_criteria: Security-relevant runtime actions emit audit events with actor/time/target/policy metadata
Policy violations create incident records with mitigation action and traceable evidence
Integration tests verify audit query/export paths from end-to-end workflow execution

title: E3-S4: Build security regression suite for no-direct-agent-write invariant
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. Add tests that prove agent cannot mutate canonical state directly.
acceptance_criteria: Regression suite covers direct and indirect write paths
Failing security tests block merges
Invariant reports are attached to CI artifacts

title: EPIC E4: Local Semantic Search
description: Weeks 4-8. Deliver local indexing, similarity retrieval, and intent-level search with measurable quality/latency gains.
acceptance_criteria: Local index builds from analyzed artifacts
Semantic search UI is usable in-plugin
Recall/latency gates are enforced

title: E4-S1: Implement local embedding pipeline and similarity adapter baseline
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Build local indexing/embedding ingestion path and baseline retrieval adapter.
acceptance_criteria: Pipeline creates searchable vectors/features for target corpus slice
Baseline retrieval API returns deterministic top-k results
Pipeline runtime and index build stats are recorded

title: E4-S2: Deliver semantic search query service and in-tool search panel
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Expose intent/similarity queries to analysts through plugin UI.
acceptance_criteria: Search service supports intent query and similar-function query
UI displays ranked results with provenance/evidence references
Search interactions are instrumented for latency metrics

title: E4-S3: Add evidence-weighted reranking for semantic results
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Improve ranking quality using receipts/evidence-derived signals.
acceptance_criteria: Reranker consumes evidence-derived features
Result ordering improves against baseline on eval slice
Fallback path exists if reranker is unavailable

title: E4-S4: Meet semantic search recall/latency gates at MVP scale
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Tune indexing/query path to hit p95 latency and recall targets.
acceptance_criteria: p95 search latency meets defined gate on target corpus size
Recall@10 improves by target delta versus stock baseline
Benchmark report is reproducible from CI artifacts

title: EPIC E5: Triage Crew v1
description: Weeks 7-10. Ship deterministic triage mission that outputs map, hotspots, unknowns, and evidence references.
acceptance_criteria: Triage mission graph is deterministic
Mission output is artifactized and reviewable
Hotspot recall target is measured

title: E5-S1: Implement deterministic triage mission graph and feature extractor
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Build triage crew mission pipeline with fixed stages and evidence hooks.
acceptance_criteria: Triage mission runs through deterministic stage graph
Mission emits entrypoints/hotspots/unknowns with evidence refs
Mission execution summary is persisted as artifact

title: E5-S2: Add triage mission UI and exportable report artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Render mission outputs in-plugin and export machine-readable summaries.
acceptance_criteria: Analyst can inspect triage map and ranked hotspots in UI
Mission outputs export to versionable artifact format
Evidence links are navigable from report to source context

title: E5-S3: Calibrate triage scoring against curated benchmark set
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Measure and tune triage precision/recall against curated labeled corpus.
acceptance_criteria: Curated triage benchmark set is versioned
Scoring calibration improves key metrics to target threshold
Calibration changes are documented with before/after results

title: EPIC E6: Type PR Lifecycle v1
description: Weeks 8-11. Add type assertions lifecycle (proposed->reviewed->accepted->propagated) and reviewer workflows.
acceptance_criteria: Type assertions persist with lifecycle metadata
Review UI supports approve/reject/change requests
Propagation and conflict handling are implemented

title: E6-S1: Persist type assertions with lifecycle metadata
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Implement storage model for type assertions and lifecycle states.
acceptance_criteria: Type assertions persist target, source, confidence, and state
Lifecycle transitions are validated server-side
Type assertions link to receipt and evidence records

title: E6-S2: Build Type PR review panel and workflow actions
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Add reviewer UI for type proposal packs with approve/reject/change requests.
acceptance_criteria: Type PR list/detail views are available in plugin UI
Review actions update lifecycle state atomically
Reviewer comments and rationale are persisted

title: E6-S3: Implement type propagation and conflict-resolution mechanics
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Propagate accepted types and handle competing assertions safely.
acceptance_criteria: Accepted types propagate according to configured scope rules
Conflicts surface with deterministic resolution workflow
Propagation can be rolled back cleanly

title: E6-S4: Add type suggestion generator with confidence thresholds
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Generate type suggestions with confidence scoring and threshold policy.
acceptance_criteria: Suggestions include confidence and evidence summary
Low-confidence suggestions are quarantined by policy
Suggestion quality metrics are collected in CI

title: EPIC E7: Corpus Sync Pilot
description: Weeks 10-12. Sync approved artifacts to shared corpus with provenance and access-control enforcement.
acceptance_criteria: Approved-only sync path exists
Provenance chain survives sync
Cross-binary reuse can be pulled back into local analysis

title: E7-S1: Build approved-only corpus sync worker
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Sync only approved artifacts from local store to shared corpus backend.
acceptance_criteria: Sync worker filters out non-approved proposals
Sync jobs are idempotent and resumable
Sync telemetry includes counts/errors/latency

title: E7-S2: Enforce provenance and access controls on corpus sync/read paths
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Require provenance continuity and policy checks for shared corpus operations.
acceptance_criteria: Synced artifacts retain complete provenance chain
Access control checks are enforced on sync and retrieval
Unauthorized requests are denied and audited

title: E7-S3: Implement cross-binary reuse and pullback into local analysis session
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Query corpus for reusable names/types/annotations and apply as proposals locally.
acceptance_criteria: Cross-binary match retrieval works from local session
Reused artifacts are inserted as proposals with receipts
Analyst can accept/reject pulled suggestions in normal review flow

title: EPIC E8: Hardening + Release Candidate
description: Weeks 11-12. Run full regression/soak, complete security signoff, and produce release candidate decision package.
acceptance_criteria: Full regression suite passes
Security signoff completed
Exit-gate report and go/no-go decision recorded

title: E8-S1: Run full regression and soak test, fix release-blocking bottlenecks
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: execute full regression/soak on real gates and JDK21-capable toolchain; resolve or waiver release-blocking failures with evidence.
acceptance_criteria: Regression suite includes executable Java/Python gates (not diff-only placeholders)
JDK21 toolchain is enforced in CI for Gradle test execution on affected modules
Soak and regression results are published with explicit blocking failures and resolutions/waivers

title: E8-S2: Execute adversarial abuse scenarios and complete security signoff
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: execute adversarial abuse scenarios against enforced policy/runtime paths and produce signed security signoff evidence.
acceptance_criteria: Abuse scenario suite artifact exists in repo and is executable/reviewable
Scenario outcomes include pass/fail, observed controls, and remediation for failures
Security signoff is documented with approver, date, and unresolved-risk notes

title: E8-S3: Package release candidate and publish operator/reviewer runbook
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. Produce installable RC and operational docs for analysts/reviewers/operators.
acceptance_criteria: Release candidate is packaged with versioned changelog
Runbook covers setup, review flow, rollback, and incident handling
Known limitations are explicitly documented

title: E8-S4: Produce MVP exit-gate report and final go/no-go decision artifact
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: publish final MVP exit-gate packet with explicit pass/fail table, waivers, residual risks, and go/no-go decision provenance.
acceptance_criteria: Exit-gate packet maps each gate to measurable evidence artifact and status
Open risks/waivers include owner, rationale, and expiration/revisit conditions
Go/no-go decision record includes approvers and dated final determination

title: EPIC R1: Roadmap Completion Remediation
description: Post-review remediation epic to close factual, integration, and release-readiness gaps found in strict audit.
acceptance_criteria: All reopened critical stories are closed with reproducible evidence
Kernel preflight/gates demonstrate executable quality checks, not placeholder checks
Final go/no-go artifact reflects real benchmark/security outcomes

title: R1-S1: Restore beads/preflight integrity for strict reproducible dispatch
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Reconcile context files and bead metadata so strict preflight succeeds without bypass flags.
acceptance_criteria: scripts/cyntra/preflight.sh passes in strict mode with no missing context files
All issue context_files point to existing repository paths
No dependency edges reference unknown issue IDs

title: R1-S2: Replace placeholder Cyntra gates with executable build/test gates
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Upgrade gate commands from diff/context sanity checks to real compile/test/eval checks.
acceptance_criteria: Cyntra test/typecheck/lint gate commands execute substantive checks tied to roadmap quality
Gate failures block issue completion when Java/Python checks fail
Gate docs and config show exact commands and expected artifacts

title: R1-S3: Add JDK21/toolchain guardrails for local + CI reproducibility
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Ensure required Java/Python toolchain versions are validated before running heavy gates/workflows.
acceptance_criteria: Preflight or bootstrap reports actionable failure when JDK21 is unavailable
CI workflow explicitly provisions compatible Java and Python versions
Developer runbook documents local setup and verification command set

title: R1-S4: Run non-toy benchmark slice and publish reproducible delta report
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Replace toy-only confidence with at least one representative non-toy benchmark run and documented deltas.
acceptance_criteria: At least one non-toy benchmark dataset slice is materialized and executed end-to-end
Metrics report compares stock baseline vs current implementation with reproducible commands
Known limitations and confidence bounds are explicitly documented

title: R1-S5: Wire proposal/security services into real runtime entrypoints with integration tests
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Move new security/proposal components from isolated unit surfaces into actual runtime/plugin call paths.
acceptance_criteria: Capability/policy/proposal flows are invoked from runtime entrypoints used by mission workflows
Integration tests validate end-to-end behavior beyond class-level unit tests
Receipt/audit evidence is emitted from integrated paths

title: R1-S6: Build and execute abuse-scenario suite artifact
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Create the missing abuse-scenario suite doc/artifacts and run it against current controls.
acceptance_criteria: docs/security/abuse-scenario-suite.md exists with executable scenarios and expected controls
Each scenario includes observed outcome, evidence link, and remediation note if failed
Results are referenced by reopened security signoff story

title: R1-S7: Reconcile backlog/runbook status surfaces with bead truth
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Eliminate status drift between beads, CSV export, and operational runbook docs.
acceptance_criteria: docs/backlog-jira-linear.csv statuses match .beads/issues.jsonl statuses
docs/cyntra-kernel-runbook.md reflects current epic/story state semantics
A repeatable export/sync command is documented

title: R1-S8: Publish MVP exit-gate packet with waiver registry and go/no-go record
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Produce final decision packet grounded in reopened regression/security/benchmark evidence.
acceptance_criteria: Exit-gate packet lists every gate with evidence artifact path and pass/fail/waived status
Waiver registry includes owner, justification, and review date
Go/no-go record includes date, approvers, and final rationale

title: R1-S9: Clean merge-conflict shadow beads and harden merge-path behavior
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Resolve/retire generated merge-conflict bead artifacts and prevent recursive conflict bead creation.
acceptance_criteria: Merge-conflict shadow issues are resolved into canonical issue history without duplicate execution targets
Kernel merge path no longer generates recursive [MERGE CONFLICT] issue chains
Runbook documents deterministic merge-failure recovery steps

title: EPIC R2: Functional Completion and Verification Closure
description: Second remediation wave to close strict factual/quality gaps, enforce build+evidence integrity gates, and prove local RC functionality end-to-end.
acceptance_criteria: All high/medium findings from post-roadmap audit are resolved with reproducible evidence
Gate/CI/validator coverage blocks regressions in Java compile and security evidence integrity
Local RC functional validation packet exists with executable command transcript and outcomes

title: R2-S1: Reconcile canonical state and closure artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Establish canonical state in reverend-main and ensure closure artifacts reflect executable evidence.
acceptance_criteria: Canonical branch/worktree for remediation is explicit and documented
Closure artifacts reference real executable evidence paths
State reconciliation evidence is retained under docs/evidence

title: R2-S2: Fix CapabilityGuard compile ambiguity and keep deny-all behavior tested
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Resolve overloaded-builder ambiguity in CapabilityGuard denyAll path and ensure tests cover behavior.
acceptance_criteria: CapabilityGuard denyAll builder call is no longer ambiguous under javac/Gradle
Generic security package compiles cleanly with JDK21
CapabilityGuard tests continue to validate deny-all fail-closed semantics

title: R2-S3: Harden local gates with Generic compile/test and evidence checksum enforcement
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Upgrade Cyntra gates from lightweight regression-only checks to blocking compile/test/evidence-integrity checks.
acceptance_criteria: gates.sh defaults context checks to fail-closed
all mode runs blocking :Generic compile + ghidra.security.* tests
all/evidence modes fail on checksum mismatch or missing abuse-scenario logs

title: R2-S4: Extend CI evaluation workflow to compile/test security-bearing Java modules
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Add blocking Generic module compile and security test steps to smoke/nightly/release workflow lanes.
acceptance_criteria: eval workflow fetches Ghidra build dependencies before module compile/test
smoke/nightly/release all run :Generic:compileJava and :Generic:test --tests ghidra.security.*
Java module compile regressions fail CI before eval metric publication

title: R2-S5: Restore abuse-scenario evidence log integrity and tracking
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Regenerate executable abuse scenario logs for 1702/1806 bundles, commit them, and keep checksum manifests valid.
acceptance_criteria: Both abuse-scenario bundles include executable scenario logs S1-S5
checksums.sha256 validates with no missing/mismatched entries
repo ignores *.log globally but tracks docs/security/evidence/**/*.log

title: R2-S6: Reconcile executable-scenario counts across harness and signoff docs
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Align wording and numeric counts for executable vs tabletop scenarios to eliminate internal contradictions.
acceptance_criteria: abuse-scenario-suite.md run summary clearly states executable count
security-signoff-checklist.md distinguishes executable scenarios from tabletop appendix scenarios
no doc claims executable scenario count greater than harness-defined total

title: R2-S7: Upgrade roadmap validator to integrity-based evidence checks
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Prevent false green closure by validating checksums/log presence and scenario-count consistency in validator output.
acceptance_criteria: validate-roadmap verifies checksum manifests and referenced files for 1702/1806 bundles
validator fails if required executable scenario logs are missing
validator enforces scenario-count consistency across outcomes json + abuse suite + signoff checklist

title: R2-S8: Clarify RC-vs-GA decision status in release artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Make release docs explicit that RC scope is GO while GA remains NO-GO pending closure conditions.
acceptance_criteria: go-no-go decision doc includes explicit GA status field
exit-gate report executive summary and recommendation separate RC pass from GA readiness
approver records remain intact while GA prerequisites stay visible

title: R2-S9: Execute full local RC functional validation matrix and publish evidence packet
description: Type: Story. Epic: R2. Run local compile/test/smoke/soak/build/headless checks and document reproducible outcomes.
acceptance_criteria: Validation packet captures command-level outputs for compile/test/smoke/soak/build/headless checks
Results include pass/fail and any environment/setup prerequisites
Packet is stored under docs/evidence/rc-functional-validation and referenced in closure summary

title: EPIC E9: SOTA Reverse Engineering Acceleration
description: Post-RC frontier execution wave that implements research-backed capabilities to make Reverend an intent-level analysis engine: knowledge graph, evidence-backed auto-annotation, dynamic-static fusion, deterministic mission crews, corpus learning, and spec extraction.
acceptance_criteria: E9-S1 through E9-S8 are completed with reproducible evidence artifacts
Dependency graph executes without unresolved blockers across all E9 lanes
Frontier capability outcomes are documented and linked to research evidence

title: E9-S1: Build whole-program knowledge graph and deterministic index
description: Type: Story. Epic: E9. Implement a graph/data index layer over functions, globals, types, strings, imports, xrefs, call edges, and provenance metadata as the foundation for intent queries and mission pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Graph schema includes core entities and relationship edges with stable IDs
Index build is deterministic/reproducible on fixed program input
Query API returns nodes/edges with provenance linkage

title: E9-S2: Implement intent-level query and similarity retrieval service
description: Type: Story. Epic: E9. Build intent query + similar-function retrieval across local index and optional corpus scope with benchmarked recall/latency instrumentation.
acceptance_criteria: Intent query API returns ranked function candidates with evidence references
Similarity retrieval supports local and corpus scopes
Benchmark artifacts capture recall and p95 latency deltas

title: E9-S3: Ship evidence-backed auto-annotation proposal engine
description: Type: Story. Epic: E9. Generate rename/type/comment proposals with receipts, confidence, alternatives, and evidence bundles to eliminate non-auditable annotation workflows.
acceptance_criteria: Proposals include xrefs/constants/callsites/trace evidence bundles
Confidence and alternative hypotheses are attached per proposal
Accepted changes remain reversible with receipt-chain integrity

title: E9-S4: Add advanced type recovery lifecycle and propagation
description: Type: Story. Epic: E9. Implement hybrid type inference and safe propagation/conflict resolution over lifecycle states to reduce decompiler ambiguity at scale.
acceptance_criteria: Type inference combines deterministic and learned signals with confidence capture
Lifecycle state transitions and conflict policy are enforced before propagation
Propagation behavior and rollback are covered by integration tests

title: E9-S5: Integrate dynamic-static fusion overlays and trace attribution
description: Type: Story. Epic: E9. Fuse debugger/emulator trace evidence into static analysis graph and expose runtime-attributed overlays for analyst workflows.
